meanings.definition: A handle of a scythe or other long-handled tool.
meanings.sent1: The farmer gripped the snathe firmly as he mowed the field.
meanings.sent2: She carefully attached the blade to the snathe before starting to work.
meanings.sent3: The snathe looked like a long, wooden arm reaching out to cut the grass.
meanings.sent4: His strong hands held the snathe with the determination of a warrior wielding a sword.
meanings.sent5: The smooth snathe felt comfortable in her grasp as she worked in the field.

meanings.definition: To cut or shape with a snathe.
meanings.sent1: He used the snathe to trim the hedge neatly.
meanings.sent2: They snathed the wood into perfect pieces for the project.
meanings.sent3: She snathed away at the clay, creating a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor snathed at the marble block, revealing the hidden figure within.
meanings.sent5: The chef skillfully snathed the vegetables into delicate shapes for the dish.

meanings.sent1: The snathe of the scythe was long and sturdy.
meanings.sent2: He inspected the snathe carefully before beginning to harvest the crops.
meanings.sent3: The snathe stood out against the green fields like a tall flagpole.
meanings.sent4: The old snathe had seen many seasons of hard work in the fields.
meanings.sent5: The worn snathe showed signs of use but remained reliable for the farmer.
